Posts.Content: Hi Hetty, thanks for that. Its been helpful getting other opinions.  What was the scalp cooling like, I don't know much about that. A xx
Posts.Title: To have or not to have Chemo

Posts.Content: Hi Daisy 10, thanks for that.  How did you chemo go? xx
Posts.Title: To have or not to have Chemo

Posts.Content: Hi all, new to forum. Was diagnosed with Grade 3 cancer in December. Its HER2 negative and oestrogen receptor positive. Had a lumpectomy and now await test to decide if Chemo would be of any benefit. They sent the tissue samples to America and now I wait for their return. Hate Waiting. What percentage did any of you decide to go ahead with chemo or not?
Posts.Title: To have or not to have Chemo

Posts.Content: Many thanks for that, definitely helpful and yes a lot to consider.  Hope J's treatment is going well. xx
Posts.Title: To have or not to have Chemo

Posts.Content: Hi Tzxy, Thanks for that .  Lymph nodes clear and clear margin from lumpectomy so good there.  I'm just impatient to get on with it all.  Had my chat with oncologist last weds and she said 10 days for results. I haven't got a follow appointment booked so am going to ring them Monday.  Have you started chemo yet? xx
